{{champion:1}} Simple, easy to pick up, and essentially point and click spells. One of those champs that can always be relevant in a game even if she gets behind, and she always has the potential to carry. Crazy burst, and snowballs pretty easily. You can go for pure damage, more mobility, take rylais for kiting, there's just so much wiggle room for builds and even if mages aren't that strong in the current meta she can still be good for solo queue. You can take her mid or try to carry the game as a support which can make playing her a little less repetitive. 

She also has powerful roaming potential so even if you're getting rekt in lane you can find a way to get another lane ahead. Awesome skins too.

I hate assassins.  Tahm's basically a giant middle finger to every assassin out there.

I've got three champions that I enjoy the most, and I can't really pick which is my favorite.  

{{champion:112}}:  Viktor has been my 'main' since I started playing his game at he start of Season 3.  After reading his lore, I immediately loved his character/personality, and after a few games I could do pretty well with his kit.  Back then Viktor was considered a troll champion, and a few of my friends tried to convince me that he was 'useless' and said 'there are better champions, pick someone else.'  When the rework came, I was a bit nervous, but found more ways to experiment and have fun with his kit.  I love the variety and adaptability it offers.  I feel like I'm never stuck to a single build, and I like experimenting with different options, based on how each game goes.  Even after all the recent nerfs, I still greatly enjoy showing others what the Glorious Evolution is capable of.  

{{champion:111}}:  Nautilus was the champion that I learned how to jungle with.  It's still my least favorite role, but as long as I've got Naut, I can do okay with it.  That said, I like playing Naut regardless of where I am or what role I'm in.  Since mid-late Season 3, I've been playing Naut in top, support, mid, and even a few custom/AI games as ADC Naut.  Note:  the last one is not very viable, but it's hilarious to watch.  I really like his audio lines, and his lore is really interesting.  I want to know more about the black substance that corrupted him in the first place, and I want to learn more about who/what he is.  Like Viktor, he's recently become a lot more popular, which is awesome, but it also means that he's getting nerfs.  I am biased, won't deny that, but I honestly don't think he needs nerfs.  He's popular because he counters FotM stuff.  When the meta changes, he'll be dropped again, and I don't think the nerfs will be reverted.  Even so, I'll still keep playing him and find new ways to fill the needs of my team.  Mobilis in Mobili.  

{{champion:161}}:  Vel'Koz was a champion that I was excited for as soon as he was announced.  His personality is fantastic, and I love his (slightly twisted) curiosity about everything.  His kit is fun, and like Viktor, I never feel too confined in a specific build path.  I normally go mid with Vel, but I'm also good at playing him in a support position, if Nautilus isn't a good pick for the circumstances.  His ability for combos is great, and while he's one of my strongest picks, I don't think he's actually OP (despite what my opponents say).  I am nervous for his upcoming rework, but as long as his character remains the same, a few kit alterations probably won't stop me from gathering information about my opponents.
